name: Ohrid
fun_fact: Fun fact: Lake Ohrid is one of Europe's oldest and deepest lakes at over 1 million years old, and it's home to a unique species of trout found nowhere else on Earth - the Ohrid trout (Salmo letnica), which locals have been fishing and grilling the same way for centuries.

hero_dishes.name: Ohrid Trout (Pastrmka)
hero_dishes.description: Fresh trout from Lake Ohrid, grilled, fried, or baked with lemon and local herbs - delicate, sweet, and unique to this ancient lake
hero_dishes.origin_story: The Ohrid trout is endemic to Lake Ohrid and has been the centerpiece of local cuisine for millennia. Overfishing threatened the species, so much of what's served now is farmed or from sustainable sources, but the traditional preparation remains unchanged
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Kaneo Restaurant (below the iconic Church of St. John), Restaurant Dalga (stunning mountain views by the lake), Letna Bavƒça Kaneo (right on the water's edge)

hero_dishes.name: Tavƒçe Gravƒçe
hero_dishes.description: Macedonia's national dish - white beans slow-cooked with onions, peppers, tomatoes, and spices, then baked in earthenware until tender
hero_dishes.origin_story: This humble bean stew represents Macedonian home cooking at its finest. The name comes from 'tava' (the earthenware pot it's cooked in). Every family has their own variation passed down through generations
hero_dishes.where_to_find: ƒåun (rustic tavern near old bazaar with hearty portions), Antiko (home-style cooking in stone building)

hero_dishes.name: Gjomleze
hero_dishes.description: A traditional Ohrid specialty - fish dish unique to the region
hero_dishes.origin_story: This dish is specific to Ohrid and reflects the city's unique culinary heritage combining Slavic, Greek, and Turkish influences from centuries of different rulers
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Restaurant Ostrovo at Sveti Naum, Dva Bisera in Rado≈æda

hero_dishes.name: Stuffed Macedonian Trout
hero_dishes.description: Whole trout stuffed with herbs, vegetables, and traditional seasonings, then baked until the skin is crispy
hero_dishes.origin_story: This traditional preparation elevates the simple grilled trout by stuffing it with local herbs from the mountains surrounding Lake Ohrid
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Dva Bisera in Rado≈æda, Restaurant Ostrovo at Sveti Naum

signature_drinks.name: Rakija
signature_drinks.description: North Macedonia's iconic fruit brandy made from grapes, plums, or other fruits - strong and aromatic
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served as a welcome drink (hospitality is sacred in Macedonian culture) and as a digestif after meals. Every family makes their own version, and homemade is always best

signature_drinks.name: Macedonian Wine
signature_drinks.description: Local wines from the Tikve≈° region, especially reds made from indigenous grapes
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Paired with grilled fish at lakeside restaurants, enjoyed slowly while watching the sunset over Lake Ohrid

food_culture_notes: St Petka restaurant has no menu - the waiter recommends daily specials and house favorites based on what's fresh
Kaneo area offers the best views - dining below the Church of St. John at Kaneo with the lake spreading below
Sveti Naum monastery area (south of Ohrid) is famous for traditional fish restaurants with stunning lake views
Makalo is a creamy garlic dip served with fish - it's ubiquitous in Ohrid and delicious

landmarks: Church of St. John at Kaneo on cliff
unique_modern: blend of Byzantine and Ottoman architecture
